titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T19:52-0400

did.abstract: This journal commenced at Deer Park on 26 April 1844, and continues to 8 October 1844. It is the record of a young woman's daily activities, including rising, dressing, sewing, making and serving meals, walking out, visits, and outings.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Associated materials in the American Philosophical Society Library,

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: Associated materials in the American Philosophical Society Library,

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This journal is also available on microfilm (Film 240, Reel 12).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Mary Jane Patterson Peale was the daughter of Rubens Peale.

controlaccess.subject: Manners and customs.
